page.title: 11A.B.C.D Swimming Pool
page.content:
In 1935 a meeting was held in Bowhill Miners Institute to form a pool committee to raise funds for a local swimming pool. At this time Dunfermline Carnagie Pool was the only indoor pool in Fife. Since the areas main industry, is mining the committee asked the miners to help raise the money. The miners agreed and a levy of 1d (old money) per week was donated by each miner in the four local mines.
The 2nd World War interrupted their efforts but the fund raising continued after the war. In 1955 a local swimming club was formed. Buses were hired to transport the swimmers to and from Dunfermline Pool. So succesful were the members that the President of the S.A.S.A said "Cardenden Swimming Club without a pool, produced more swimming honours, than most (cont.)
